Package taskallocation

Class TaskManager

java.lang.Object
taskallocation.TaskManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.Observer, ITaskManager
public class TaskManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements ITaskManager
Implementation of ITaskManager. Use Observer design pattern obtain notifications of the failures. De-allocates task assigned to the worker process on receiving the failure notification. Creates Task for each allocation. All the implementations and data structures are thread-safe. Does not handle task requests directly, for request management, check TaskAllocationServer.
Author:
somilgupta

  • Method Details

    • allocateTask

      public Task allocateTask​(int workerId) throws NoTaskAvailableException
      Description copied from interface: ITaskManager
      Allocate the task if any available. If a task is already allocated to the worker, then return back the same task. This function should ideally be called after querying availability at {ITaskManager.isAnyTaskAvailable()}.
      Specified by:
      allocateTask in interface ITaskManager
      Parameters:
      workerId - Identifier of the worker.
      Returns:
      Task denoting the allocated task to be done.
      Throws:
      NoTaskAvailableException - Race condition may cause the task to get allocated before request. In that case no task would be available and this exception would be thrown. Upstream should catch this exception and take action.

    • deallocateTask

      public void deallocateTask​(int workerId)
      Description copied from interface: ITaskManager
      Deallocate the task assigned to the worker. This may happen when the worker dies unexpectedly and task needs to be reallocated. Should do nothing if already de-allocated.
      Specified by:
      deallocateTask in interface ITaskManager
      Parameters:
      workerId - worker identifier.

    • isAnyTaskAvailable

      public boolean isAnyTaskAvailable()
      Description copied from interface: ITaskManager
      Checks if any task is available for allocation. Please note that even though this shows true at the moment of call, the task may get allocated when allocation request made. Caller must treat both calls as atomic to prevent race conditions.
      Specified by:
      isAnyTaskAvailable in interface ITaskManager
      Returns:
      True if available else false.

    • areAllTasksCompleted

      public boolean areAllTasksCompleted()
      Description copied from interface: ITaskManager
      Notifies true when there is no task left to allocate and no ongoing active task.
      Specified by:
      areAllTasksCompleted in interface ITaskManager
      Returns:
      true when all tasks are notified by the workers to be completed.

    • markTaskCompleted

      public void markTaskCompleted​(int workerId)
      Description copied from interface: ITaskManager
      Marks the task to be completed. This should ensure that the task does not appear in the available/ongoing task pool.
      Specified by:
      markTaskCompleted in interface ITaskManager
      Parameters:
      workerId - workerId that completed the task. The task allocated to this worker is completed.

    • update

      public void update​(java.util.Observable o, java.lang.Object arg)
      Specified by:
      update in interface java.util.Observer
